page.title: 08The hedges of Denbury Hill.
page.content: When we visited{Denbury Hill}we made several{hedge counts}to discover if the hedges had been there when the first Domesday Book was being written. {We used the rule}that each different tree or shrub species in a thirty metre stretch of the hedge represented one hundreds years of its growth. Counts (north side of hill fort). From{longditude 281600:}Beech, Bramble Field Maple, Hawthorn, Hazel, Holly, Honeysuckle, Ivy, Oak, Sycamore. From{longditude 281700:}Ash, Bramble, Dogrose, Dogwood, Elder, Field Maple, Hawthorn, Holly, Honeysuckle, Hornbeam Ivy. Counts (east side of lane). From{longditude 281800:}Ash, Bramble, Bryony, Dogrose, Elder, Field Maple, Hazel, Honey, Honeysuckle, Ivy. From{latitude 068600:}Ash, Blackthorn, Bramble, Dogrose, Elder, Field Maple,
